      • getPriorDayOfWeek

        public static java.util.Calendar getPriorDayOfWeek​(java.util.Calendar checkDate,
                                                   java.lang.String dayOfWeek)
                                            throws InvalidValueException
        Given a date and the day of the week, return the date of that day-of-the week prior to the checkdate. eg: Input January 9, 2020 and "Tuesday", return January 7, 2020
        Parameters:
        checkDate -
        dayOfWeek - Non-case-sensitive string value: "Sun", "Sunday", "Mon", "Monday", etc.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        InvalidValueException

      • makeBindVariables

        public static java.lang.String makeBindVariables​(java.util.List<? extends java.lang.Object> objectList)
        When you have a list of values that you want to match in the database, you will want to create a prepared statement where there is a variable number of bind variables. (That's all those question marks). This method will generate that list of question marks. Here's how it works:
        List idList = ** some list of values that you got somewhere ** String bindVariables = AppUtils.makeBindVariables(idList); PreparedStatement ps = conn.prepareStatement("select * from some_table where some_field in " + bindVariables); for ( n = 0; n < idList.size(); n++ ) { ps.setInt(n+1, idList.get(n); } ResultSet rs = ps.executeQuery() The sql that gets generated will be of the form: select * from some_table where some_field in (?,?,?,?) where the number of ?'s matches the number of values in the list.
        Parameters:
        objectList -
        Returns:
